snippet.textDisplay: This game is often seen as the weakest in the series, but it might actually be my favorite. I only played the first 3 though because I really felt burned after going through Bowser's Inside Story, which a lot of people find is the best one. Funny how that goes! What's for sure, this game has my favorite soundtrack in the M&L series.
snippet.textOriginal: This game is often seen as the weakest in the series, but it might actually be my favorite. I only played the first 3 though because I really felt burned after going through Bowser's Inside Story, which a lot of people find is the best one. Funny how that goes! What's for sure, this game has my favorite soundtrack in the M&L series.

snippet.textDisplay: Was saddened that Bowser's inside story got a 3ds remake and this game was left untouched
snippet.textOriginal: Was saddened that Bowser's inside story got a 3ds remake and this game was left untouched

snippet.textDisplay: This was the first I ever beat, followed by Inside Story and Superstar Saga (screw Cackletta). Also happens to be the one I've replayed the most, and it never gets old.
snippet.textOriginal: This was the first I ever beat, followed by Inside Story and Superstar Saga (screw Cackletta). Also happens to be the one I've replayed the most, and it never gets old.

snippet.textDisplay: Naaah. Bowser's Inside Story has the best soundtrack. :P
snippet.textOriginal: Naaah. Bowser's Inside Story has the best soundtrack. :P

snippet.textDisplay: Oh wow, I got a bit burned out after inside story too, after having partner's in time be my favorite one. Hadn't seen until now someone with the same story. I don't know what it is, but inside story was just lacking the sort of charm that superstar saga and partners in time had for me. I wonder if somehow the setting itself was less able to draw me in.
snippet.textOriginal: Oh wow, I got a bit burned out after inside story too, after having partner's in time be my favorite one. Hadn't seen until now someone with the same story. I don't know what it is, but inside story was just lacking the sort of charm that superstar saga and partners in time had for me. I wonder if somehow the setting itself was less able to draw me in.

snippet.textDisplay: I can’t decide if Partners in Time is my favorite or Bowser’s Inside Story. I tend to lean towards Partners in Time more though since I loved its world, narrative, and battle system. I thought Dream Team was good, but it just overstayed its welcome, and Paper Jam was just annoying with all the rescue missions to me.
snippet.textOriginal: I can’t decide if Partners in Time is my favorite or Bowser’s Inside Story. I tend to lean towards Partners in Time more though since I loved its world, narrative, and battle system. I thought Dream Team was good, but it just overstayed its welcome, and Paper Jam was just annoying with all the rescue missions to me.

snippet.textDisplay: @Loose Goose numerous unskipable tutorials are present until the very last hour of the game. It ruined the flow of the game for me.
snippet.textOriginal: @Loose Goose numerous unskipable tutorials are present until the very last hour of the game. It ruined the flow of the game for me.

snippet.textDisplay: You're gonna judge the game by some measly tutorials that are only at the very start of the game? okay!
snippet.textOriginal: You're gonna judge the game by some measly tutorials that are only at the very start of the game? okay!

snippet.textDisplay: @Loose Goose I prefer Paper Jam over Dream Team! Tutorials are depressing in DT
snippet.textOriginal: @Loose Goose I prefer Paper Jam over Dream Team! Tutorials are depressing in DT

snippet.textDisplay: This one is honestly my favorite also, I played the hell out of this game lol

snippet.textDisplay: J'ai passé tellement de nuit blanche sur ce jeu. I love it

snippet.textDisplay: This game was a beast. The first of the series I played back then. The story is the second best in the franchise after bowsers inside story. Paper Jam can fuck itself in the grave. Good night guys.
snippet.textOriginal: This game was a beast. The first of the series I played back then. The story is the second best in the franchise after bowsers inside story. Paper Jam can fuck itself in the grave. Good night guys.

snippet.textDisplay: The most depressing Toad Town ever. I do quite enjoy this game, but it is my second-least favorite in the series (never played Paper Jam). I like it better than Dream Team, though. PiT is very linear, but I think DT really dragged on after a while. It's unfortunate that Nintendo decided to not make a remake for PiT.
snippet.textOriginal: The most depressing Toad Town ever. I do quite enjoy this game, but it is my second-least favorite in the series (never played Paper Jam). I like it better than Dream Team, though. PiT is very linear, but I think DT really dragged on after a while. It's unfortunate that Nintendo decided to not make a remake for PiT.

snippet.textDisplay: Nintendo made sure no one would remember this, can't let them
